title-group.article-title: Correlation among the Stocks of 28 Major Industries in Taiwan and Prices of Dubai Crude and Brent Crude

bio.p: Tzu-Yi Yang is an associate professor in the department of business and management at Ming Chi University of Technology in New Taipei City, Taiwan. tyyang@mail.mcut.edu.tw
Chin-Mei Chou is an assistant professor in the department of tourism leisure and health at Ching Kuo Institute of Management and Health in Keelung City, Taiwan. chouchinmei@gmail.com
Yu-Tai Yang is an assistant professor in the department of aeronautical and opto-mechatronic engineering at Vanung University in Taoyuan City, Taiwan. yang5629@vnu.edu.tw
Nguyen Phuc Nguyen is an associate professor in the department of economics at The University of Danang in Da Nang City, Viet Nam. nguyennp@due.edu.vn

abstract.p: Crude oil imports have significantly impacted many industries in Taiwan's economy and investment market. This study applies EViews9 statistical software and multiple regression methods to design a model to compare Dubai and Brent crude oil price with trading volumes of 28 major industries in Taiwan. The results show that stocks of most sectors correlate with Dubai and Brent crude prices. The authors investigate the strength and directional impact of this relationship with oil prices.
